item.title: Geslatt Principles
item.description: Gestalt (means form, shape in German) is a group of visual perception principles developed by German psychologists in 1920s. It is built on the theory that “an organized whole, is perceived as greater than the sum of its parts”. Principles Emergence People tend to identify elements first in their general outlined form. Our brain recognises a simple, well-defined object quicker than a detailed one. Multi-Stability People will often interpret ambiguous objects in more than one ways.
